Write similarity matrix.

Source: R/sim_read-write.R
sim_write.Rd

sim_write writes similarity matrix.

sim_write(sim_df, output, file_format = "parquet")

Arguments

sim_df

metric_sim object.

output

character string specifying the output directory or filename.

file_format

character string specify file format. This must be one of csv or parquet(default).

Details

The output format can be either CSV or Parquet.

With the CSV format, the row_metadata and metric_metadata attributes are saved as separate files.

This is not required for Parquet because it saves the attributes as well.

Examples

suppressMessages(suppressWarnings(library(magrittr)))
population <- tibble::tibble(
  Metadata_group = sample(c("a", "b"), 4, replace = TRUE),
  x = rnorm(4),
  y = x + rnorm(4) / 100,
  z = y + rnorm(4) / 1000
)
sim_df <- matric::sim_calculate(population, method = "pearson")
sim_df %>% matric::sim_write("/tmp/test", file_format = "csv")
#> NULL
readr::read_csv("/tmp/test/test.csv")
#> Rows: 12 Columns: 3
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> dbl (3): id1, id2, sim
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> # A tibble: 12 × 3
#>      id1   id2   sim
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1     2     1 0.521
#>  2     3     1 0.809
#>  3     4     1 1.00 
#>  4     1     2 0.521
#>  5     3     2 0.923
#>  6     4     2 0.502
#>  7     1     3 0.809
#>  8     2     3 0.923
#>  9     4     3 0.796
#> 10     1     4 1.00 
#> 11     2     4 0.502
#> 12     3     4 0.796
readr::read_csv("/tmp/test/test_metadata.csv")
#> Rows: 4 Columns: 2
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (1): Metadata_group
#> dbl (1): id
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> # A tibble: 4 × 2
#>      id Metadata_group
#>   <dbl> <chr>         
#> 1     1 a             
#> 2     2 b             
#> 3     3 b             
#> 4     4 b             
jsonlite::read_json("/tmp/test/test_metadata.json")
#> $method
#> $method[[1]]
#> [1] "pearson"
#> 
#> 
sim_df %>% matric::sim_write("/tmp/test.parquet")
#> NULL
sim_df_in <- arrow::read_parquet("/tmp/test.parquet")
attr(sim_df_in, "row_metadata")
#> # A tibble: 4 × 2
#>      id Metadata_group
#>   <int> <chr>         
#> 1     1 a             
#> 2     2 b             
#> 3     3 b             
#> 4     4 b             
attr(sim_df_in, "metric_metadata")
#> $method
#> [1] "pearson"
#>
